DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluates the effectiveness of treatment osteopathic manipulation in the treatment of subjects with chronic nonspecific low back pain.
DOC.brief_title: Osteopathic Manipulative Treatment Versus Therapeutic Exercises in Subjects With Chronic Non-specific Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: Subjects with constant or intermittent low back pain with intensity greater than 30 mm visual analog scale (VAS) for at least three months duration, with a diagnosis of chronic low back pain Subjects who have spine fractures, Dislocations Ligament ruptures Muscle ruptures Skin lacerations Sacroiliitis Vertebral osteomyelitis Infection Disc herniations with radicular symptoms Rheumatic disorders Cauda equina syndrome Tumors Referred pain visceral Red flags Lower limb discrepancy greater than 2 cm Several conditions requiring participants to be absent for more than two weeks of activities in the experiment Positioning itself as not volunteer the same.
